alert.note: Alert for Giles (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 1:29AM CST until February 05 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Richland Creek Above Pulaski affecting Giles County. For the Richland Creek...including Pulaski...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Richland Creek Above Pulaski. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low lying agricultural land along the river begins * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 14.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.9 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM CST.
